nodes.text: Star Wars Magazine (previously known as Lucasfilm Magazine) was the official French-language Star Wars magazine, published from 1995 to 2009 by Courleciel under the initiative of Patrice Girod.

Originally conceived as a 52-page quarterly publication, the Lucasfilm Magazine became a 68-page bimonthly periodical from the tenth issue onward. The publication title was changed to Star Wars Magazine following the release of the seventy-fourth issue.

Due to the poor business environment, Courleciel discontinued operations before releasing the eightieth issue of the magazine, dated November-December 2009. However, the official StarWars.com website provided that last issue as a PDF file.
